main.p: The Endings project funding from the Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council of Canada (SSHRC) has enabled us to complete a great deal of practical and theoretical work, listed here:
Our work has received a great deal of favourable feedback; here are some posts and publications mentioning Endings:

ul.li: Bauer, Joe. New Services and Resources to Support Digital Projects in the Humanities and Qualitative Social Sciences. MLSA Technology Services, University of Michigan. October 9, 2021. https://lsa.umich.edu/technology-services/news-events/all-news/search-news/archive/lsa-technology-services-announces-digital-scholarship-studio.html.
CLE Teaching Collaborative. The Endings Project. https://www.referatory.cleteaching.org/items/show/832.

Crompton, Constance. Planning Web Projects for Longevity and Sustainability. Course offered at DH@Site (Ottawa), May 24-25, 2022. Workshop modelled on the Endings Project. https://dhsite.org/dhsite-2022-workshops/.

Daniel, Dominique. Special Issue of the Digital Humanities Quarterly: Project Resiliency in the Digital Humanities. H-HistBibl. June 9, 2023. https://networks.h-net.org/node/14775/discussions/12872598/special-issue-digital-humanities-quarterly-project-resiliency.
DH@Bucknell. Ending and Archiving Your Project. https://dhbucknell.scholar.bucknell.edu/resources/dh-tools-software/ending-archiving-your-project/.
Donlon, Anne, et al. Project: The Endings Project. dh+lib review. April 15, 2021. https://dhandlib.org/2021/04/15/project-the-endings-project/.
Han, Sophia. Digital Longevity in the Digital Humanities: The Endings Symposium. A Conversation with Joey Takeda. June 30, 2021. https://www.lib.sfu.ca/help/publish/dh/dhil/dhil-blog/endings-project.

McCarthy, Gavan; La Rosa, Marco; Thieberger, Nick (2023). Online Heritage Resource Manager (OHRM) Datasets transformed to Research Object Crates as part of the Describo Collections Integration Project.. University of Melbourne. Collection. https://doi.org/10.26188/c.6795084.v2.
McGrath, Jim. Project Endings and Precarious Labor. July 19, 2023. https://jimmcgrath.us/teaching/project-endings-and-precarious-labor/.
Narlock, Mikala R. Digital Preservation Services at Digital Scholarship Centers. Journal of Academic Librarianship vol. 47, no. 3 (2021). https://doi.org/10.1016/j.acalib.2021.102334.
NC State University Libraries. Digital Scholarship. No date. https://www.lib.ncsu.edu/do/digital-scholarship.
Robinson, Peter. staticSearch and Me: getting started. 20 July 2023. https://scholarlydigitaleditions.blogspot.com/2023/07/staticsearch-and-me.html.
Robinson, Peter. In praise of staticSearch. 6 August 2023. https://scholarlydigitaleditions.blogspot.com/2023/08/in-praise-of-staticsearch.html.
Roy Rosenzweig Center for History and New Media Sustainable DH Project. No date. High Level Resources. https://sustainabledh.org/resources.
Tucker, Joanna. Facing the Challenge of Digital Sustainability as Humanities Researchers. Journal of the British Academy No. 10: 93-120 (2022). https://doi.org/10.5871/jba/010.093.

Young, Chris. Syllabus for INF2256 -- Digital Scholarship. University of Toronto Faculty of Information. Winter 2022. https://sites.utm.utoronto.ca/chrisyoung/sites/sites.utm.utoronto.ca.chrisyoung/files/public_assets/INF2256_DigitalScholarshipSyllabus_20220104_1.0.pdf.
